abstract: The cable industry is touting a standard that will let developers write applications for set-top boxes. After five years of work there are hardly any apps and very few developers.
snippet: The cable industry is touting a standard that will let developers write applications for set-top boxes. After five years of work there are hardly any apps and very few developers.
lead_paragraph: The cable industry needs to learn a lesson or two from Apple’s iPhone. That’s a message I heard throughout my time at the Cable Show in Washington. In particular, several executives boasted of new technology that would open set-top boxes to applications written by independent developers, much as Apple has done with the iTunes App store.

headline.main: Cable Is Building Apps for Your TV — Slowly
